intro: Tetrastigma touranense, commonly known as the Touranese crossvine, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Vitaceae, which includes grapes and other vine species. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. Its berries are typically yellow or orange when ripe and are often used in traditional medicine. Tetrastigma touranense thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
